docs.text: warner brothers ; rated pg-13 ( mild violence , sexual situations ) ; 132 minutes
docs.label: negative

docs.text: director : luis mandoki
docs.label: negative

docs.text: screenplay : gerald di pego ( from the novel by nicholas sparks )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: cast : kevin costner , robin wright-penn , paul newman , illeana douglas , robbie coltrane , jesse james , john savage .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: review by : geoff berkshire
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'm not an overly cynical guy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there have been many glossy hollywood romances that have carried me away with their romanticism over the years .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , i have my limits and i also have standards .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this brings us to the subject at hand : message in a bottle , the big ticket romance that warner brothers' unleashed upon the movie going public just in time for valentine's day .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the story , what little of it that there is , involves boring chicago tribune reporter theresa osborne ( robin wright-penn ) dealing with her recent divorce and trying to raise her young son jason ( jesse james ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: during a brief stay somewhere in new england she finds the titular message in a bottle while on a morning run by the ocean .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the letter , written to a mystery woman named catherine , instantly captivates her .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: upon her return , theresa shares it with her best friend lina ( illeana douglas ) , her boss charlie ( robbie coltrane ) , and the entire city of chicago ( the newspaper publishes an article about it ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it turns out that the message was written by grieving widower garret blake ( kevin costner ) and so theresa travels to north carolina and tracks him down .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he turns out to have a colorful father ( paul newman ) but is otherwise perfectly dull and overly obsessed with sailing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is somehow attractive to theresa and the two begin their awkward courtship .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: of course she doesn't tell him that she found his letter , she wants to but the rules of this type of film require him to find out later ( preferably right after they first make love ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this way garret can get very angry and the relationship can be threatened .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the discovery of the message and garret's discovery that theresa discovered the message are really the only two noteworthy events that happen during the nearly two and a quarter hour running time of this film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's a truly lame subplot about garret's relationship with his dead wife's family ( he gets into a bar fight with her brother , played by john savage ) and then the necessary tear-jerking ending .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a fun way to pass the time is to take bets on exactly who will die , although it becomes pretty clear by the second reel .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the actual death sequence is one of the most ridiculously forced , and unintentionally humorous , sequences filmed since . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: well , since costner's the postman ( 1997 ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: message in a bottle is one slow moving film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: last year audiences were offered endurance tests such as the horse whisperer and meet joe black but both of those films resemble jerry bruckheimer productions next to this .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they also had redeeming qualities in the form of quality performances and some stand out technical work .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: message in a bottle has a decent enough cast but they're fighting the material all the way , and losing badly .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: costner and , especially , wright-penn are both likable and attractive enough to cheer for but their characters are simply too boring .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they also fail to generate any kind of real romantic chemistry .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the supporting players are given very little to do .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the reliable douglas is particularly wasted .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: old pro newman gives his all and occasionally threatens to kick some life into this dead horse of a film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a confrontational scene he has with costner near the end is especially well played .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , too frequently he just reminds us how unexciting our lead characters are .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film is very polished on the technical side to be sure but it only works to undercut the story .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: gabriel yared , who previously set the romantic moods of the english patient ( 1996 ) and city of angels ( 1998 ) with his scores , overdoes it a bit here .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: caleb deschanel's camera makes everything look a little too beautiful .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: do the offices of the chicago tribune really need to look heavenly ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the editing by steven weisberg is troubling not only considering all that could have been cut out but is also simply messy at times .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the real offender here is screenwriter gerald di pego .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: working from a best- selling novel by nicholas sparks ( which i have not read but have been told is on the same literary level as the bridges of madison county ) , di pego creates one of the most uninspired scripts of recent times .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: its strict adherence to clich ? s brings to mind such disasters as i still know what you did last summer ( 1998 ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there simply isn't an original scene in this film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the dialogue is rarely better than laughable and this is only accentuated by the excessively long pauses every character takes while speaking .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is director mandoki's first film since when a man loves a woman ( 1994 ) , the solid meg ryan/andy garcia romance .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he's simply going through the motions with this .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: message in a bottle is easily the worst of the several romantic offerings available in theaters at the moment and vies with what dreams may come ( 1998 ) as one of the most misguided romances of the decade .
docs.label: negative
